Exe

Ivan Jacob Agaloos Pesigan

2021-02-17

Source: vignettes/Exe.Rmd
Exe.Rmd

This vignette provides examples for the Exe function in the yacR package.

library(Ryacas)
#> 
#> Attaching package: 'Ryacas'
#> The following object is masked from 'package:stats':
#> 
#>     integrate
#> The following objects are masked from 'package:base':
#> 
#>     %*%, det, diag, diag<-, lower.tri, upper.tri
library(yacR)

We start with the matrix \(\mathbf{A}\) whose elements are \(\left\{ a, b, c, d \right\}\).

(A <- matrix(c("a", "b", "c", "d"), ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE))
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,] "a"  "b" 
#> [2,] "c"  "d"

\[\begin{align*}\mathbf{A} &=\left( \begin{array}{cc} a & b \\ c & d \end{array} \right)\end{align*}\]

We need to convert the matrix A into a yac_symbol first. This can be done using the Ryacas function ysym().

(A <- ysym(A))
#> {{a, b},
#>  {c, d}}

Example 1

The Determinant of A can be obtained in Yacas with the expression Determinant(A).

expr1 <- paste0("Determinant(", A, ")")

The following returns a yac_symbol output.

(yac_symbol <- Exe(expr1, expression = FALSE, format = "ysym"))
#> y: a*d-b*c
str(yac_symbol)
#> List of 3
#>  $ yacas_cmd: chr "a*d-b*c"
#>  $ is_mat   : logi FALSE
#>  $ is_vec   : logi FALSE

The following returns a string output.

(string <- Exe(expr1, expression = FALSE, format = "str"))
#> [1] "a*d-b*c"
str(string)
#>  chr "a*d-b*c"

The following returns a laTeX mathematics output.

(latex <- Exe(expr1, expression = FALSE, format = "tex"))
#> [1] "a d - b c"
str(latex)
#>  chr "a d - b c"

LaTeX mathematics can be displayed using the following.

cat(
  "\\begin{align*}",
  "\\det \\mathbf{A} &=",
  latex,
  "\\end{align*}",
  sep = ""
)

\[\begin{align*}\det \mathbf{A} &=a d - b c\end{align*}\]

The following returns an R expression output.

yacR::Exe(expr1, expression = TRUE)
#> expression(a * d - b * c)

Example 2

In the following example we derive the Transpose of the matrix A with the expression Transpose(A).

expr2 <- paste0("Transpose(", A, ")")

The following returns a yac_symbol output.

(yac_symbol <- Exe(expr2, expression = FALSE, format = "ysym"))
#> {{a, c},
#>  {b, d}}
str(yac_symbol)
#> List of 3
#>  $ yacas_cmd: chr "{{a,c},{b,d}}"
#>  $ is_mat   : logi TRUE
#>  $ is_vec   : logi FALSE

The following returns a string output.

(string <- Exe(expr2, expression = FALSE, format = "str"))
#> [1] "{{a,c},{b,d}}"
str(string)
#>  chr "{{a,c},{b,d}}"

The following returns a laTeX mathematics output.

(latex <- Exe(expr2, expression = FALSE, format = "tex"))
#> [1] "\\left( \\begin{array}{cc} a & c \\\\ b & d \\end{array} \\right)"
str(latex)
#>  chr "\\left( \\begin{array}{cc} a & c \\\\ b & d \\end{array} \\right)"

LaTeX mathematics can be displayed using the following.

cat(
  "\\begin{align*}",
  "\\mathbf{A}^{\\mathsf{T}} &=",
  latex,
  "\\end{align*}",
  sep = ""
)

\[\begin{align*}\mathbf{A}^{\mathsf{T}} &=\left( \begin{array}{cc} a & c \\ b & d \end{array} \right)\end{align*}\]

The following returns an R expression output.

yacR::Exe(expr2, expression = TRUE)
#> expression(rbind(c(a, c), c(b, d)))

Numeric

The R expression outputs can be evaluated numerically using the eval function. The symbols a, b, c, and d should have values in the environment eval is using.

a <- 1
b <- 2
c <- 3
d <- 4

Below is the numerical result for example 1

eval(yacR::Exe(expr1, expression = TRUE))
#> [1] -2

which is equal to the following.

det(matrix(1:4, ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE))
#> [1] -2

Below is the numerical result for example 2

eval(yacR::Exe(expr2, expression = TRUE))
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]    1    3
#> [2,]    2    4

which is equal to the following.

t(matrix(1:4, ncol = 2, byrow = TRUE))
#>      [,1] [,2]
#> [1,]    1    3
#> [2,]    2    4
